gate.plugin.learningframework.data

Class CorpusRepresentationVolatileDense2JsonStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • gate.plugin.learningframework.data.CorpusRepresentation
      • gate.plugin.learningframework.data.CorpusRepresentationVolatileBase
        • gate.plugin.learningframework.data.CorpusRepresentationVolatileDense2JsonStream

  • public class CorpusRepresentationVolatileDense2JsonStream
extends CorpusRepresentationVolatileBase
    Common base class for non Mallet volatile representations. This is for representations which are "volatile" i.e. whenever something is added it is not kept in memory. Data could get immediately written to a file or database or immediately passed on to an online training algorithm.

    This tries to handle both sequence and non-sequence corpora.

    Author:
    Johann Petrak

      • CorpusRepresentationVolatileDense2JsonStream

        public CorpusRepresentationVolatileDense2JsonStream(File outDir,
                                                    FeatureInfo featureInfo)
        The constructor needs to specify the file where to save the instances to. Note: if several threads use this instance, they should all share the just this one instance, and their calls to the add method will automatically get synchronized.

      • startGrowth

        public void startGrowth()
        Enable the addition of new features or feature values when instances are added. After a CorpusRepresentationMallet instance is created, growth is enabled by default.
        Overrides:
        startGrowth in class CorpusRepresentationVolatileBase

      • add

        public void add(gate.AnnotationSet instancesAS,
                gate.AnnotationSet sequenceAS,
                gate.AnnotationSet inputAS,
                gate.AnnotationSet classAS,
                String targetFeatureName,
                TargetType targetType,
                String instanceWeightFeature,
                String nameFeatureName,
                SeqEncoder seqEncoder)
        Add instances from the document. This adds any instances to the corpus, i.e. convert annotations first to the internal dense instance representation, then converts the dense instances to JSON and writes them to the stream which must have been opened when this corpus representation was created.

        NOTE: this method is automatically synchronized and should be save to use from multiple threads

        !!!TODO: explain which methods are used by this to convert to dense internal instance representation and then to the final output format.

        Specified by:
        add in class CorpusRepresentationVolatileBase

        sequenceAS - TODO
        inputAS - TODO
        classAS - TODO
        targetFeatureName - TODO
        targetType - TODO

        seqEncoder - TODO
